title: Profile Overview
text: The Profile Overview is where you can select the Composer Group to be used as the "Landing Group" for each of your applications at a specific location. This allows you to customize your apps based on the location they are used in. You can use the tabbed menu to switch between the applications and view the list of stores you have within Imagine in the table below. To create or modify your stores, use the Backoffice. The Composer Profile is the layout of buttons that will be displayed as the initial view for the selected location's application. To select or change the Composer Profile and Visual Profile for a specific location, click on the corresponding row in the table. This will display a dropdown menu where you can make your selections. When making changes to the Composer Profile or Visual Profile for a store location, it is important to save the changes by clicking the "Save" button. It is recommended to save changes before switching to another application tab. It is important to note that any changes made here will be immediately reflected in your front-end applications, so make sure to double-check your changes before saving.

title: Creating a New Composer Group
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Creating a New Composer Group Adding Tiles to a Composer Group Time Restricted Tiles Amending Tiles Composer Groups are a collection of tiles that are presented to the user as a selection of options in front-end applications. Each application requires a "Landing Group," which serves as the starting point for users to engage with the application. The selection of the landing group is configurable on a per-application and per-location basis in the Profile Overview section of the Backoffice. Creating a New Composer Group The Composer Group List displays all existing groups. To edit a group, simply click on the relevant group. To create a new Composer Group, click the "Create New" button. You will be taken to the below page. Display Name Refers to the name that will be visible to customers on the Self Serve Applications. It is the name that identifies the Composer Group and its content. Name It's important to use a unique name for the Composer Group as you cannot use the same name multiple times. If you try to use a name that already exists, you will receive a warning message. Image URL This is the image that will appear on the tile. The supported image types are .bmp, .gif, .jpeg, and .svg. Image Fill Setting This setting determines how the image will be displayed within the tile: Centred: The image will be positioned in the middle of the tile. Fill: The image will be resized to fill the entire tile, potentially cropping parts of the original image. After making any changes or updates to the Composer Group, click on the "Save Composer Group" button to save the changes. Once saved, a notification will appear in the top right corner to confirm that the changes have been saved. Adding Tiles to a Composer Group To add a Tile to a composer group, follow these steps: Click on the Composer Group you want to add a Tile to. Select the "Add Tile" button. A window will appear with options for which type of Tile you require. Choose the type of Tile you want to add. You will then be asked to search for and select an instance of the type you have chosen. Once you have selected the Tile instance, you can configure the settings for the Tile. Click "Save" to save the Tile to the Composer Group. A notification in the top right corner will appear to confirm that the Tile has been added to the Composer Group. Choosing a Tile Type Item This is a single Tile without grouping or stacking. Composer Group This is a Tile in which tiles will have a group or stack. Bundle A Composite Tile allows for multiple items to be displayed in a single Tile, such as a meal deal that includes both a drink and a meal. Advert This will create an Advert Tile. Advert Tiles are typically used in apps that run on the consumer's devices, but may not be suitable for kiosks or self-checkout systems. Options for Creating a New Entity and Relevant Pages Create a new Item This will take you to the Item Creation page. Create a new Bundle This will take you to the Product Configurator> Bundles page. Create a new Composer Group This will take you to a blank new Composer Group Page. Time Restricted Tiles You can set times for when you require a tile to appear or disappear. This is helpful for certain periods of the day, for example, having different meal types for Breakfast or Lunchtimes. You can also have promotional tiles linked to different items/bundles with special prices if required. Times are set in 30-minute increments and are not a specific reference to a time of day relevant for time zones. For example, if you set the time for "3 pm" then the tiles will display relative to the time of that location I.E Happy Hour in London and New York can both be 3 pm-4 pm, relative to when those cities reach that time. Amending Tiles When you hover your mouse over a tile, the edit symbol will appear. Click this to begin editing the tile. To delete a tile, use the delete button located in the top left corner. If the tile is part of a Composer Group, you will see a "Go to Group" button. Clicking this will take you to the selected group for editing. To save any changes made to the Composer Group, click on the "Save Composer Group" button. Note that this button is disabled until changes are made on the selected group. If you wish to delete a Composer Group, click on the "Delete" button. A prompt will appear to confirm the deletion. Selecting "Yes" will permanently delete the Composer Group, while selecting "No" will cancel the action. The Tiles are displayed in a grid format that can be rearranged by dragging and dropping them into place. The order of the Tiles is always from left to right, assuming one long wrapped row. This is because each device has different dimensions, and the Tiles need to be responsive to fit all screen sizes. Active Tiles are displayed with a white background, while inactive Tiles are displayed with a grey background. Inactive Tiles are not displayed to customers.

Composer Groups are a collection of tiles that are presented to the user as a selection of options in front-end applications. Each application requires a "Landing Group," which serves as the starting point for users to engage with the application. The selection of the landing group is configurable on a per-application and per-location basis in the Profile Overview section of the Backoffice.

Creating a New Composer Group

The Composer Group List displays all existing groups. To edit a group, simply click on the relevant group. To create a new Composer Group, click the "Create New" button.



You will be taken to the below page. 



Display Name
Refers to the name that will be visible to customers on the Self Serve Applications. It is the name that identifies the Composer Group and its content.
NameIt's important to use a unique name for the Composer Group as you cannot use the same name multiple times. If you try to use a name that already exists, you will receive a warning message.
Image URL
This is the image that will appear on the tile. The supported image types are .bmp, .gif, .jpeg, and .svg.
Image Fill Setting
This setting determines how the image will be displayed within the tile:

Centred: The image will be positioned in the middle of the tile.

Fill: The image will be resized to fill the entire tile, potentially cropping parts of the original image.


After making any changes or updates to the Composer Group, click on the "Save Composer Group" button to save the changes. Once saved, a notification will appear in the top right corner to confirm that the changes have been saved.

Adding Tiles to a Composer Group

To add a Tile to a composer group, follow these steps:

  1. Click on the Composer Group you want to add a Tile to.
  2. Select the "Add Tile" button.
  3. A window will appear with options for which type of Tile you require. Choose the type of Tile you want to add.
  4. You will then be asked to search for and select an instance of the type you have chosen.
  5. Once you have selected the Tile instance, you can configure the settings for the Tile.
  6. Click "Save" to save the Tile to the Composer Group.
  7. A notification in the top right corner will appear to confirm that the Tile has been added to the Composer Group.




Choosing a Tile Type

ItemThis is a single Tile without grouping or stacking.
Composer Group
This is a Tile in which tiles will have a group or stack.
BundleA Composite Tile allows for multiple items to be displayed in a single Tile, such as a meal deal that includes both a drink and a meal.
AdvertThis will create an Advert Tile. Advert Tiles are typically used in apps that run on the consumer's devices, but may not be suitable for kiosks or self-checkout systems.



Options for Creating a New Entity and Relevant Pages
Create a new ItemThis will take you to the Item Creation page.
Create a new Bundle
This will take you to the Product Configurator> Bundles page.
Create a new Composer Group
This will take you to a blank new Composer Group Page.


Time Restricted Tiles

You can set times for when you require a tile to appear or disappear.

This is helpful for certain periods of the day, for example, having different meal types for Breakfast or Lunchtimes. You can also have promotional tiles linked to different items/bundles with special prices if required. 

Times are set in 30-minute increments and are not a specific reference to a time of day relevant for time zones.  

For example, if you set the time for "3 pm" then the tiles will display relative to the time of that location I.E Happy Hour in London and New York can both be 3 pm-4 pm, relative to when those cities reach that time.


Amending Tiles

When you hover your mouse over a tile, the edit symbol will appear. Click this to begin editing the tile.

To delete a tile, use the delete button located in the top left corner.



If the tile is part of a Composer Group, you will see a "Go to Group" button. Clicking this will take you to the selected group for editing.



To save any changes made to the Composer Group, click on the "Save Composer Group" button. Note that this button is disabled until changes are made on the selected group.


If you wish to delete a Composer Group, click on the "Delete" button. A prompt will appear to confirm the deletion. Selecting "Yes" will permanently delete the Composer Group, while selecting "No" will cancel the action.



The Tiles are displayed in a grid format that can be rearranged by dragging and dropping them into place. The order of the Tiles is always from left to right, assuming one long wrapped row. This is because each device has different dimensions, and the Tiles need to be responsive to fit all screen sizes.


Active Tiles are displayed with a white background, while inactive Tiles are displayed with a grey background. Inactive Tiles are not displayed to customers.

title: Adverts
text: Adverts are tiles that allow you to sell promotional space within your front-end apps and provide links to off-site content. However, it's important to note that this functionality does not include link tracking or any metrics. Adverts are not recommended for use with the Kiosk or SCO, as they are designed to be used on personal devices. Adverts List This is the Advert List. Here you can view all existing adverts, search for a specific advert, create a new advert, or edit an existing one. Advert Adverts only require 3 properties to be provided Name The Advert Name is used for internal reference and is not displayed to customers in the front-end applications. It helps you identify and organize your adverts in the Backoffice. Redirect URL This is the URL the user will be sent to, in a new browser tab, if they click the tile on their device. Image URL The URL to the image that appears on the tile. Only .bmp, .gif, .jpg and .svg type images are supported.
